Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*All travellers: The Foreign Ministry website is regularly updated with details of the latest entry requirements. If you’re fully vaccinated: You can enter Georgia without needing to test or quarantine. You will need to present a COVID-19 vaccine certificate confirming receipt of two full doses of the vaccine (or one dose in the case of Johnson & Johnson).
Find out if you qualify as fully vaccinated in Georgia on The Foreign Ministry website.You should arrange to take a private test. *Proof of vaccination status: Georgia will accept the proof of COVID-19 recovery and vaccination record and proof of COVID-19 vaccination issued in the Crown Dependencies. Your final vaccine dose must have been administered at least 14 days prior to travel. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
Residents of Georgia can also use a COVID-19 Green Pass issued by the National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) to demonstrate their vaccine status.
*If you’re not fully vaccinated: If you’re not fully vaccinated, you can enter Georgia but you must present a negative PCR test taken within the previous 72 hours. There is now no need for further testing in Georgia.
*If you’ve had COVID-19 in the last six months: If you present proof of having been infected with COVID within the previous 100 days and have had the first jab in a two-dose vaccination process, you do not need to test or quarantine to enter Georgia.
If you were infected more than 100 days previously or have no proof of recovery or vaccination status, you can enter Georgia but you must present on arrival a negative PCR test taken within the previous 72 hours. There is now no need for further testing in Georgia.
*Children and young people: Children aged 9 and under follow the rules for fully vaccinated travellers to enter Georgia and are exempted from any PCR tests.
*If you’re transiting Georgia: There are no separate rules for transiting Georgia. You should follow the regulations outlined above depending on your vaccination status.
*Exemptions: There are no exemptions to Georgia’s entry requirements.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Georgia: Inter-city and municipal public transport and taxis are operating normally. Face masks must be worn in all public transport and taxis.
*Accommodation: Hotels and rental accommodation are open. Face masks must be worn when entering public spaces inside hotels and rental accommodation.
*Public spaces and services: It is mandatory to wear masks in public places indoors (shops, hotels etc) but the requirement to wear a mask outdoors was dropped from 1 March. Failure to wear a mask when required can result in a 20 Lari fine for an individual or 500 Lari for a legal entity.
Systematic COVID-19 testing of staff working in trading, catering and teaching professions is taking place.
You can find full details of the latest restrictions from the Government of Georgia. *If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
